name: Gloria Van Graff
descriptions: Gloria Van Graff, or simply Glory by her half-brother, is the head of the Van Graff family in New Vegas and manager of the Silver Rush energy weapons store in 2281.
Gloria is the ambitious daughter of the Van Graff matriarch, who has expanded her family's operations into the Mojave Wasteland (largely because she did not get along with her parents).
Her general strategy is to maximize profits through official and unofficial deals, as well as undercutting the competition.
Of course, Gloria has bigger ambitions. As the Legion was making entreaties towards traders in the Mojave, she contacted one of their representatives and agreed to provide them with energy weapons.

Gloria is a passionate woman and has been known to have held intimate relationships with Kings member Pacer and with a former Van Graff employee Jacob. Both have ended on less than amicable terms. Other than those two relationships, Gloria has been known to sleep with many employees of the Van Graffs'; so much so that her mother has told her to not "tip the help."

Pacer's relationship with Gloria, while never mentioned in-depth, is reason enough for Pacer to nose around in the business of the Van Graffs. Pacer often harasses Simon during his shift, but an action like that could easily result in an easy and well-disguised political assassination.

The other relationship with Jacob was as straight forward as could be with the power dynamic between manager and employee. Gloria had admitted to Jacob that she gets easily jealous and would only entertain the relationship if he stayed loyal to her. While Jacob promised to do so, he was later caught by Gloria at Gomorrah being serviced by one of their prostitutes.

PC Playstation 3 Xbox 360 Gloria drops drained microfusion cells in place of drained small energy cells. This bug is present with every plasma pistol user, as the particular leveled list for equipping a non-player character with a plasma pistol and ammunition (WithAmmoPlasmaPistolLoot, to be precise) calls for microfusion cells in place of energy cells.

topics.response_text: Good job. I need to work out some last minute details with our new clients, but after that we'll head back to the Rush.
I suppose you have a few questions.
They're taking an awfully long time inspecting the weapons. I'm beginning to think they're doing it just to unnerve us.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to see what you have for sale.
topics.response_text: Of course.
Please let me know if anything catches your eye.

topics.topic_text: I was wondering if you had any work available.
topics.response_text: It just so happens a position opened up recently. It's not much, but it'll be a good way for me to gauge your potential for future assignments.
Wonderful. I already have a man outside who can show you the ropes and get you set up. His name is Simon.

topics.topic_text: Sorry, I have better things to do.
topics.response_text: Suit yourself. Was there anything else you wanted?

topics.topic_text: Mind if I ask you some questions?
topics.response_text: Not at all.

topics.topic_text: So is this a family business?
topics.response_text: Yes it is. My brother and I run this particular branch, but our family has operations all over, particularly in California.

topics.topic_text: This seems like a bad neighborhood to open a store.
topics.response_text: Look around, and you'll notice two things.
This place is certainly lively, that's for sure. Did you want to know something specific about it?
Oh, there's not much to tell. I was born into a big family and don't get along with my parents, so here I am. As far away from them as possible.
Unfortunately, I found someone else with a little more experience, and he'll take over the position starting tomorrow.
There's a deal that we've been working on for a while now and the buyer would like a sample of our weapons.
Well, look who doesn't need my money any more. When you find your pockets a little lighter, stop back.
Good, here's the package. I'll mark the location on your map. The buyer said they'd be in town for quite a while so there's no rush.

topics.topic_text: I'm not a delivery boy. Not interested.
topics.response_text: Very well. Let me know if you change your mind. The buyer said they'd be in town for quite a while, so there's no rush.

topics.topic_text: He said you'd hear from them soon.
topics.response_text: Good... good. Here's your payment. If you'll excuse me, I have some thinking to do.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about this client?
topics.response_text: It's better if you don't ask. Now I believe I asked you a question. What was their reaction?
Perfect. We're still getting everything together, but I can always find a use for idle hands in the meantime.
That's okay, I still need some time to get everything together. The logistics of an order like this are headache inducing.
I don't have time to explain now. Just do as you're told and we'll all be rich.
That's what I like about you. You follow orders, for the most part. Just remember to wait for the signal.
Not if we don't screw this up. I'm counting on you to do your part. Just wait for the signal. You'll know what to do.

topics.topic_text: Just thought I'd stop in and say hello.
topics.response_text: You're welcome here any time.

topics.topic_text: For starters, what in the hell just happened?
topics.response_text: We made a lot of money, that's what. The Legion paid us to deliver weapons, and the NCR paid us to deliver the Legion. Or some of them, anyway.

topics.topic_text: I thought you hated the NCR?
topics.response_text: Oh, I do. They're a bunch of corrupt, bullying fools who think they can tell everyone how to live their lives, and my family's fought them for years.
Caesar has been making overtures to prominent suppliers for some time now. Usually, they're too scared of him to cross him and just pay or flee.

topics.topic_text: So now the Van Graffs are allied with the NCR?
topics.response_text: Well... not exactly. The deal wasn't exactly sanctioned by my mother, but she'll come around when she hears about the profit I made.

topics.topic_text: Wouldn't you have made just as much money dealing with the Legion?
topics.response_text: Hardly. They've got a lot of soldiers, and slaves. But they don't come close to having the amount of wealth the NCR has.
It'll be all I can do to supply the NCR with the amount of weapons they want, so I'll be pretty busy for the foreseeable future.
Ah, the "rulers" of Freeside. The Kings are a bunch of boys who refuse to grow up, and this is their playground.
I don't really have much to do with them. They seem to have an aversion to weapons technology, and those who possess a great deal of it.

topics.topic_text: What is there to do here?
topics.response_text: Well, you probably noticed the Atomic Wrangler across the street. That's pretty much the place to go around here.
Suits me. What did you have in mind?

topics.topic_text: There's a rumor that there's a feud between your family and Pacer. What's that about?
topics.response_text: It's just a rumor. Even so, I trust you will refrain from bringing up this subject again.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of the NCR?
topics.response_text: You must not know a lot about my family or you wouldn't have asked that. The Van Graffs and the NCR have been enemies for decades.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of the Legion?
topics.response_text: I've only heard rumors, since this is the furthest east our operations go. But the rumors are pretty scary.

topics.topic_text: What do you know of Mr. House?
topics.response_text: Very little, same as everyone else. We attempted to deal with him when we first moved into the area, but had no luck.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of the Gun Runners?
topics.response_text: They're our chief competitors in this region, and many others. That makes them our enemies.

conversation.response_text: Their commander is down! Kill the rest!
I trust you find everything acceptable?
Everything. Up until recently, this man was an employee of mine. He's quite handsome, don't you think?
Mr. Soren, please get to the point. The second half of your payment is late and I want to know why.
Jean-Baptiste, could you bring out the volunteer?
This is a lesson, Mr. Soren. A lesson in faith.
Never break faith with the Van Graffs, Mr. Soren.
Okay everyone, show's over. Back to work!
